44f76762d837de6adc8900ece7ab6b7b (12:24): Ok. I know I asked this before and was told that QWidgetStack could do this, but I am just looking for a "simple" way to tell a Widget not to draw itself anymore once a particular event comes along. Surely there is a way to tell a Widget not to draw itself anymore at all, and none of its children too???

44f76762d837de6adc8900ece7ab6b7b (12:25): I have already written much code and really do not want to get into the using the QWidgetStack just for this. It seems like over kill since my stack will never be more than 2 high.
44f76762d837de6adc8900ece7ab6b7b (12:26): I am doing something somewhat non-orthodoxe anyways... I just need to know how to tell a given Widget to shutup... so to speak.
9162bbd5c86e37f5c65c8d4a6406beaf (12:42): hm, if i connect an action to a slot, then call sender() in the slot, does that return the action?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:43): no, the QObject that triggered the action
9162bbd5c86e37f5c65c8d4a6406beaf (12:43): So, what triggers the action then?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:43): test it and print the object name
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:44): you can set that for all qobjects and widgets. can help in debugging
9162bbd5c86e37f5c65c8d4a6406beaf (12:58): so I finally got that to work
9162bbd5c86e37f5c65c8d4a6406beaf (12:58): I'll look at that dumpObjectInfo, though.
9162bbd5c86e37f5c65c8d4a6406beaf (12:59): so, bleh, no debugging info compiled in.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (13:02): sender() can return 0 though, so always check it
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (13:03): if the slot was somehow called directly

e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:04): it's not enough that the pro file "includes" a header file, the source must do it too
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:05): never include a .cpp file unless you really know what you do and why
2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (14:07): so i include baum.h in main
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (14:07): that is some weird include-mess you have there :)
2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (14:08): do i have to include the header files or the cpp files in main?
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (14:08): also, protect your header files with #ifndef __YOURHEADER_H__, #define __YOURHEADER_H__
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:08): as i said: never include a .cpp file unless you really know what you do and why
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:09): never include a .cpp file unless you really know what you do and why
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (14:09): never include a .cpp file unless you really know what you do and why
2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (14:09): but i have to include the .cpp files at the end of the header
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (14:09): oh, he has a #include "baum.cpp" in cinput.h as well
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (14:10): you never have to include a source file, that's what makefiles are for.
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (14:11): you should probably read up on the different stages of compiling, it would make you understand this
